{"id":990233956,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 months, 1 week","timestamp":1688914418,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"116 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/990233956/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Number of Jumps to Reach the Last Index","memory":"61.9 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    \n    int find(int ind,vector<int>&nums,int tar,vector<int>&dp)\n    {\n        if(ind==nums.size()-1)\n        {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        if(dp[ind]!=-1)return dp[ind];\n        \n        int ans=INT_MIN;\n        \n        for(int i=ind+1;i<nums.size();i++)\n        {\n            if(abs(nums[i]-nums[ind])<=tar) //checking  if we can jump to i\n            {\n                ans=max(ans,1+find(i,nums,tar,dp)); // jump to i \n            }\n        }\n        return dp[ind]= ans;\n    }\n    int maximumJumps(vector<int>& nums, int tar)\n    {\n       vector<int>dp(nums.size(),-1);\n        int ans=find(0,nums,tar,dp);\n       if(ans>0)\n           return ans;\n        else\n            return -1;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-number-of-jumps-to-reach-the-last-index","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
